title: already borrowed: BorrowMutError

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

body:
### Code

https://github.com/akula-bft/akula/commit/3c1d3e2385557398b4d175b196b69deeb307f7c9


### Meta

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.57.0-nightly (51e514c0f 2021-09-12)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 51e514c0fb4f9afcaae3b02dd9ccb93e15b30ef8
commit-date: 2021-09-12
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.57.0-nightly
LLVM version: 13.0.0
```

### Error output

```
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'already borrowed: BorrowMutError', compiler/rustc_infer/src/infer/combine.rs:952:50
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace

error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md

note: rustc 1.57.0-nightly (51e514c0f 2021-09-12) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu

note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 --crate-type lib

note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden

query stack during panic:
#0 [evaluate_obligation] evaluating trait selection obligation `((ethereum_types::H160, ethereum_types::H256), models::BlockNumber): kv::traits::TableObject`  |  = note: this failure-note originates in the macro `decl_table` (in Nightly builds, run with -Z macro-backtrace for more info)

#1 [check_mod_item_types] checking item types in module `kv::tables`
end of query stack
```
